definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to be perched high/to be located prominently/to be preeminent
lit. where tigers crouch and dragons coil (idiom); fig. forbidding terrain
lit. where tigers crouch and dragons coil (idiom); fig. forbidding terrain
to flee in disorder and encamp somewhere
variant of 盤踞|盘踞[pan2 ju4]

sentences.english: It soon came out that Peter and Alice going to get married.
sentences.chinese: 布久刁家知道撂彼得和艾丽坦将要踞婚的消孝。

sentences.english: The table is led by Fernando Alonso with 96 points.
sentences.chinese: 而阿隆索仍以96分的成绩踞于榜首。

sentences.english: Vancouver also has long been near the top of global surveys in terms of quality of life.
sentences.chinese: 而且，温哥华长期踞于全球生活质量调查排行的前列。

sentences.english: May be sensed without danger, it hastily back squat.
sentences.chinese: 可能是感觉到没有危险，它又急急地跑回蹲踞之处。

sentences.english: Her parents tried to pair her with a rich neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 她赌父墓想让她煌一滚有钱赌鳞坑踞婚。

definition: variant of 盤踞|盘踞[pan2 ju4]
lit. where tigers crouch and dragons coil (idiom); fig. forbidding terrain

crouching tiger/fig. major figure in hiding/concealed talent
to rise steeply from level ground
